Laurian Gridinoc wrote:
>
> Hello,
>
> Is there any way to share objects among the processors of a crawl job?
> something like the web application scopes; ie. application scope (at
> heritrix instance level), session scope (at crawl job level) and maybe
> crawlUri level scope?
>







You can have objects live the life of the current process chain or they 
can persist beyond so they are available on every trip down along the 
processing chain.  You can also have CrawlURIs inherit properties from 
their parent CrawlURI.

Use these setters to add to CrawlURI:

http://crawler.archive.org/apidocs/org/archive/crawler/datamodel/CandidateURI.html#putString(java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String)

(And the variants, putLong, putString, etc.)

For items you want to persist across processing runs, add a key to this 
list:

http://crawler.archive.org/apidocs/org/archive/crawler/datamodel/CrawlURI.html#addAlistPersistentMember(java.lang.Object)

See processors such as ChangeEvaluator for example usage.

For key/values you want inherited as you crawl, add key using:

http://crawler.archive.org/apidocs/org/archive/crawler/datamodel/CandidateURI.html#makeHeritable(java.lang.String)

Sounds like their usage is not plain.  Let us know how we can improve 
the API or, what we should add to facilitate your use case.

Does Processor#initialTasks and Processor#finalTasks work for job scope? 

There is no means for persisting objects across crawl jobs at the 
moment, unless you subclass Heritrix (I've added an RFE).

St.Ack
